faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain. Non-Spanish residents and EU citizens have the same property acquisition rights as Spanish nationals. You will need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number) for the purchase process. Our team can guide you through all legal requirements and connect you with specialists in international property acquisition. The process is straightforward with proper professional guidance.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Property acquisition costs in Spain typically include transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (0.5-1%), and registration costs (0.1%). For Murcia properties like VILLAS ALTEA, transfer tax is approximately 7%. Additional costs include legal fees and property surveys. Financing options are available through Spanish banks for qualified international buyers. We provide detailed cost breakdowns during consultation.
